justification: “Traditionally, evidence both for and against a threshold in source memory has come from the examination of Receiver Operating Characteristic (ROC) curves.”

“Harlow and Donaldson (2013) addressed the need for more diagnostic data in the source memory literature by using a continuous-outcome task instead of a two-choice task, which yielded a continuous measure of response accuracy.”

measured_by: continuous-outcome task using the method of adjustment
justification: “Wilken and Ma (2004) … used it to investigate how the representations of items in visual working memory change with the number of items that stored.”

“The continuous-outcome task has its origins in the method of adjustment of classical psychophysics, in which sensory thresholds were measured by asking participants to adjust the intensity of a variable stimulus to match a standard.”
